column4: im running windows xp right now, so if anyone has any experience with windows (i hear most linux users dont but its worth a shot) isnt there something you can enter in the command prompt to switch your harddrive from ntfs to fat32?
so after i format it the filesystem no longer matters?
you can not convert from ntfs back to fat32 but from fat32 to ntfs in windows xp you need 3rd party apps like partition magic or diskdirector
and windows can only format fat32 with 20gbytes since windows 2000
